definitions.example: I stretched the rubber band until it almost broke.
The rubber band stretched almost to the breaking point.
First, stretch the skin over the frame of the drum.

definitions.definition: To get more use than expected from a limited resource.
definitions.example: I managed to stretch my coffee supply a few more days.
To say crossing the street was brave is stretching the meaning of "brave" considerably.

definitions.definition: To extend physically, especially from limit point to limit point.
definitions.example: The beach stretches from Cresswell to Amble.

definitions.definition: To extend one’s limbs or another part of the body in order to improve the elasticity of one's muscles
definitions.example: Cats stretch with equal ease and agility beyond the point that breaks a man on the rack.

definitions.definition: To extend to a limit point
definitions.example: His mustache stretched all the way to his sideburns.

definitions.definition: To stretch the truth; to exaggerate.
definitions.example: a man apt to stretch in his report of facts

definitions.definition: To sail by the wind under press of canvas.
definitions.example: The ship stretched to the eastward.

definitions.definition: To make great demands on the capacity or resources of something.
